Message: The user completes the submission of the form
I want to turn off my ad account. I was recently billed  even though I had no active campaigns.

I'm sorry to hear about the billing issue. To turn off your ad account, you can follow the steps in our Account Management Guide. If you need further assistance or want to dispute the billing, please email adsupport@newsbreak.com with details of your account and billing issue. Here's the guide for reference: [Account Management Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17539290349709-Account-Management-Guide). Let me know if there's anything else I can help with!
how do I remove my credit card so this doesn't happen again?

Once you've uploaded your primary payment method, you can't remove your credit card from your account. However, you can update it with another card if needed. If you're concerned about future charges, consider switching to Prepay instead of Autopay. For more details on billing options, check out our [Billing Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17821681919757-Billing-Guide). Let me know if you have any other questions!
how do I delete my ad account?

Unfortunately, you can't delete an ad account, but you can rename it or create a new one if needed. If you're looking to stop using the account, you can simply stop running campaigns and remove any payment methods associated with it. For more details, check out our [Account Management Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20333724725133-How-to-create-separate-ad-accounts). Let me know if there's anything else I can assist with!
but I can't remove the payment methods, and do not see how to change from autopay to prepay

I understand your concern. Unfortunately, once a credit card is added as the primary payment method, it cannot be removed. However, you can update it with another card. To switch from Autopay to Prepay, you would need to add ad credits to your account instead of relying on automatic charges. If you're having trouble with this process or need further assistance, please email adsupport@newsbreak.com for help.
I have turned off all campaigns, ad sets, and ads...   If I incur future charges, these will be disputed with my credit card company. fair warning...

I understand your frustration, and I'm sorry for any inconvenience. Since you've turned off all campaigns, ad sets, and ads, there shouldn't be any future charges. If you do encounter any unexpected charges, please reach out to adsupport@newsbreak.com immediately to resolve the issue. Your proactive approach is noted, and I hope everything goes smoothly from here on.
